articles.title: The scary implications of the world’s first AI-orchestrated cyberattack

articles.title: Giving C a Superpower

It demonstrates how to develop leak-free and thread-safe programs, exemplified by a secure 'grep' utility, preventing common programming errors. This guide provides C developers with practical insights and tools to significantly enhance code reliability and safety, fostering more stable and efficient software development.

articles.title: Boost to warfighting readiness as Britain’s aircraft carrier fully ‘mission ready’ and committed to NATO for the first time

This significantly enhances the alliance's air power and collective security. Simultaneously, UK Defence and Foreign Secretaries are meeting Italian counterparts, reinforcing Anglo-Italian defence cooperation and broader strategic partnerships within NATO.

articles.title: Boost to warfighting readiness as Britain’s aircraft carrier fully ‘mission ready’ and committed to NATO for the first time

articles.title: AgustaWestland case: Delhi HC declines to hear Christian Michel’s plea on India-UAE extradition treaty provision
articles.summary: Christian Michel James, alleged middleman in the AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam, withdrew his plea challenging a provision of the India-UAE extradition treaty from the Delhi High Court. This development concerns a major defence procurement corruption case, emphasizing India's legal pursuit of financial offenders and the complexity of international legal cooperation in upholding accountability within defence deals.

articles.title: The Kamini Kaushal You Didn't Know
articles.summary: Veteran Indian actress Kamini Kaushal passed away at 98, just two years shy of becoming a centenarian. Her remarkably long, rich, and creatively fulfilling life was noted for its extensive experiences and accomplishments, leaving little unfulfilled. She leaves behind a significant legacy in Indian cinema and culture, marking the end of an illustrious era.
